gurmukhi: Awj BXo auqpwq bfo fr mwn sBY hir pws pukwry ]kop krXo hm pY mGvw iqh qy biRj pY brKy Gn Bwry ]
transliteration: Ooj Bhayo Outpaat Bado Dar Maan Sabhai Har(i) Paas Poukdare|| Kop Daryo Ham Pai Maghvaa Tih Te Brij Pai Barkhe Ghan Bhaarre||
translation: A great crime has been committed today, therefore all, having been frightened and crying for Krishna, said, “Indra has become angry with us, therefore it is raining cats and dogs over Braja;

gurmukhi: B`iC BKXo ieh ko qumhU iqh qy biRj jn kop sMGwry ]r`Ck ho sB hI jg ky qum r`C kro hmrI rKvwry ]364]
transliteration: Bhachchh(i) Bhakhyo Eh Ko Toumhoo Tih Te Brij Jan Kop Sanhdare|| Rachchhak Ho Sabh Hijag Ke Toum Rachchh Daro Hamrirakhvaarre||364||
translation: “You have eaten the material brought over Indra’s worship, therefore, in great rage, he is destroying the people Braja; O Lord ! You are the protector of all, therefore protect us also.364.

gurmukhi: hoie kiRpwl AbY Bgvwn kiRpw kir kY ien mo qum kwFo ]kop krXo hm pY mGvw idn swq iehw brKXo Gn gwFo ]
transliteration: Hoe Karipaal Abai Bhagvaan Abai Bhagvaan Kridaa Kar(i) Kai In Mo Toum Kaadho|| Kop Daryo Ham Pai Maghvaa Din Saat Ihaa Barkhyo Ghan Gaddho||
translation: “O Lord! kindly save us from these clouds; indra has become angry with us and for the last seven day, there had been heavy raining here;”

gurmukhi: BRwq blI iein r`Cn ko qb hI kir kop BXo auT TwFo ]jIv gXo Gt myGn ko sB gopn ky mn AwnMd bwFo ]365]
transliteration: Bhraat Baliin(i) Rachchhan Ko Tab Hikar(i) Kop Bhayo Outh Thaadho|| Jeev Gado Ghat Meghan Ko Sabh Gopan Ke Man Aanand Baadho||365||
translation: Then getting infuriated, Balram got up for their protection and seeing him arising, on one side, the clouds became fearful and on the other side, there was increase of joy in the mind of gopas.365.

gurmukhi: gopn kI suinkY ibnqI hir gop sBY Apny kr jwxy ]myGn ky bDby khu kwnH clXo auiT kY krqw joaU qwxy ]
transliteration: Gopan Kisoun(i)kai Bintihar(i) Gop Sabhai Apne Kar Jaane|| Meghan Ke Badh-be Kauh Kaahn Chadyo Outh(i) Kai Kartaa Jooo Taane||
translation: Hearing the request of the gopas, Krishna called all the gopas with the signs of his hand; the powerful Krishna moved for killing the clouds;

gurmukhi: qw Cib ky js au`c mhwN kib ny Awpny mn mY phcwxy ]ieau cl gXo ijm isMG miRgI ipK Awie hY jwn ikDo muih fwxy ]366]
transliteration: Taa Chhab(i) Ke Jas Ouchch Mahaan Kabi Ne Aapane Man Mai Pahchaane|| Io Chal Gado Jim Singh Mrigipikh Aae Hai Jaan Kidho Muh(i) Daane||366||
translation: The poet considering this spectacle in his mind, says, “Krishna moved like a roaring lion, seeing the deer, with his mouth wide open.”366.

gurmukhi: myGn ky bD kwj clXo Bgvwn ikDo rs BIqr r`qw ]rwm BXo jug qIsr miD mrXo iqn rwvn kY rn A`qw ]
transliteration: Meghan Ke Badh Kaaj Chadyo Bhagvaan Kidho Ras Bheetar Rattaa|| Raam Bhayo Joug Jeesar Madh(i) Daryo Tin Raavan Kai Ran Attaa||
translation: With great ire, Krishna moved to destroy the clouds; he had destroyed Ravana in Treta age as Ram;

gurmukhi: AauD ky bIc bDU brDo khu kop kY boln qy ijh s`qw ]gopn gopn r`Cn kwj qrXo iqhko gj ijau md m`qw ]367]
transliteration: Audh Ke Beech Badhoo Bardhe Kauh Kop Kai Bolan Te Jih Sattaa|| Gopan Godhan Racchhan Kaaj Daryo Tihko Gad Jio Mad Mattaa||367||
translation: He had powerfully ruled Oudh alongwith Sita; the same Krishna moved today for the protection of gopas and cows like an intoxicated elephant.367.

gurmukhi: krby khu r`C su gopn kI br pUt lXo ng kop hQw ]qnko n khXo bl rMck qwh krXo ju huqo kr bIc jQw ]
transliteration: Karbe Kauh Racchchh Su Gopan Kibar Poot Layo Nag Kop Hathaa|| Tamko Na Kahyo Bal Ranchak Taah Daryo Joo Houto Kar Beech Jathaa||
translation: For the protection of gopas, Krishna, greatly infuriated, uprooted the mountain and placed it on his hand; while doing this, he did not use even an iota of his power;

gurmukhi: n clI iqnkI ikCu gopn pY kib sXwm khY gj jwih rQw ]muiK nXwie iKswie clXo giH pY ieh bIc clI jg ky su kQw ]368]
transliteration: Na Chalitinkikichh(u) Gopan Pai Kabi Syaam Kahai Gad Jaah(i) Rathaa|| Moukh(i) Nyaae Khisaae Chadyo Grih Pai Eh Beech Jag Ke Su Kathaa||368||
translation: No force of Indra could work on gopas and he, in embarrassment and with down-cast face, he went towards his home, the story of the glory of Krishna became prevalent in the whole world.368.
